docs.snippet: VIGO, Spain, May 29--German submarines, lurking off the Spanish coast, accounted for three ships yesterday and today, sinking the Argentine freighter Uruguay, 3,425 tons, and a French merchantman, and setting afire a British tanker.
docs.lead_paragraph: VIGO, Spain, May 29--German submarines, lurking off the Spanish coast, accounted for three ships yesterday and today, sinking the Argentine freighter Uruguay, 3,425 tons, and a French merchantman, and setting afire a British tanker.

docs.abstract: Branch party established by German Nazi party; known as Uruguayan Dist Group of German Natl Soc Party; levies income taxes for remittance to Germany; other activities; Govt pushes home defense measures; Germans seek govt protection following anti-Nazi demonstrations

headline.main: Organization Revealed; DESTRUCTION WROUGHT AND PRISONERS TAKEN IN BATTLE ZONE

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 1--Europe's war of nerves has reached South America. Rumors of an alarming nature, most of which undoubtedly are false, are keeping the people nervously jumpy and ready to believe even the most improbable whispers.

headline.main: WAR ALARM GROWS IN SOUTH AMERICA; Nations Speed Arms Programs as Rumors of Peril Fray Nerves of the Public NAZIS ADMIT INVASION AIM But Stress Plan to Bore From Within Pending Victory of Reich in Europe

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: IF the completion of the campaign to raise $1,000,000 did not convince you that the Metropolitan Opera is going ahead with plans for next season, perhaps the news that the opening night has been set will. The 1940-41 season will begin on Dec. 2 and...
docs.lead_paragraph: IF the completion of the campaign to raise $1,000,000 did not convince you that the Metropolitan Opera is going ahead with plans for next season, perhaps the news that the opening night has been set will. The 1940-41 season will begin on Dec. 2 and will run for sixteen weeks.
